mdRecord.dcterms:title: Haemacytometer in case
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Spencer Lens Company [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Blood testing apparatus in a maroon case. Ribbon inside lid is marked with a very faded "Spencer Buffalo."The haemocytometer (01786a) is engraved "Spencer Buffalo U.S.A. Bright-Line Improved Neubauer 1/10 mm deep Patented." The number 8823 is scratched into it. There are two pipettes, one with a larger bulb (01786b) and one with a smaller bulb (01786c). There is one additional 1 1/8" long piece of glass (01786d).
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus
